Description: Rim sherd of Chian pottery Type B1 kantharos; white slip; interior: reserved band around rim and glazed streaky black below; part of lotus bud in added white outline with added red centre followd by single white band; exterior: trace of brown line on edge of rim and reserved below; inscription on exterior.
Curator's comments: Kantharoi Type B1 have lotus flowers and lotus buds on the interior (Williams 1983, 169) and many kantharoi Type B have painted inscriptions beneath the rim; several have been found on Aegina as well as at Naukratis. Williams, D. ‘Aigina, Aphaia-Tempel 5. The pottery from Chios’, Archäologischer Anzeiger 1983
Bibliographic references: Cook & Woodhead 1952 / Painted Inscriptions on Chiot Pottery (p. 167, no. 104)
Bernand 1970 / Le Delta égyptien d'après les textes grecs, i: les confins libyques (p. 724, no. 829)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1830) (phase 2)
